profileAlternative.name: Chris Gervang
profileAlternative.headline: Senior Software Engineer at Uber Elevate
profileAlternative.summary: Visualization and Data Software Engineer by day, Hardware Art enthusiast by night. Loves to learn how stuff is built. Skilled in TypeScript, React, Deck.gl, Python, Java, F#, SQL, and HTML/CSS. Strong self taught engineering professional.

aboutAlternative.text: Visualization and Data Software Engineer by day, Hardware Art enthusiast by night. Loves to learn how stuff is built. Skilled in TypeScript, React, Deck.gl, Python, Java, F#, SQL, and HTML/CSS. Strong self taught engineering professional.

positions.title: Tachyus

positions.description: Developed water cut sensors. Designed PCB layouts which proved product viability. Implemented firmware. Researched valve mechanics. Deployed prototype to field. Named on patent for sensing methods.

positions.title: Product Design & Developer Intern
positions.description: Worked Compass, a website for Stanford undergraduates to design a mission-driven educational plan.

given.text:
When Chris was invited to switch from hardware to software, I wanted him on my team. Everyone wanted him on their team. I was primarily doing devops and back-end development. It was easy to mentor Chris. He asks the right questions and picks stuff up fast. He opted for front-end web development and excelled at it. When I switched back to the front-end team, he was mentoring me. He provided wonderful documentation and patience. Chris was a pleasure to work with. He possesses both the necessary soft and technical skills and comes highly recommended.
…
See more

I was Chris's product manager, and I dearly hope Chris Gervang and I get to work together again sometime. He cares about WHY the product matters, and HOW the customer feels using it. If he disagrees with a design decision, he'll bring it up the problem AND propose possible solutions. When he asked me a question, most of the time I just asked him "what would you do if you couldn't ask me?" And his answers were almost always what we ended up going with.
…
See more

In running CodeDay SV, Chris showed that not only does he have fantastic technical skills (which I'd already known), but that he's able to get things done in a business setting, as well. He did a great job at making partnerships, promoting, and managing the budget for the event, and made sure the entire thing went down without any bugs. I feel extremely lucky to have had him on my team.
…
See more

received.text:
Adam has an impressive ability to come to understand the world, and transit that understanding to others. When he doesn't know something, Adam will ask fantastic questions.

The attitude he brings to work inspires focus and positivity. Even when faced with a challenge, Adam remains collected and enthusiastic.

When presenting, Adam clearly demonstrates the motivations for our work, and reminds me to focus on the people we are building for and the problems they face. The lessons I've learned from him I believe will continue to help me far into my career.

Tyler has been an enormous help in organizing my first CodeDay. His unique set of skills as a developer, instructor, and mentor makes him an efficient and experienced leader. I hope to work with him again soon.
